channel.title: Linked List on Roman Kurnovskii
channel.description: Recent content in Linked List on Roman Kurnovskii

item.title: 2. Add Two Numbers
item.description: Before task: Create function for test data - code snippet You are given two non-empty linked lists representing two non-negative integers. The digits are stored in reverse order, and each of their nodes contains a single digit. Add the two numbers and return the sum as a linked list. You may assume the two numbers do not contain any leading zero, except the number 0 itself. Example 1: Input: l1 = [2,4,3], l2 = [5,6,4] Output: [7,0,8] Explanation: 342 + 465 = 807.

item.title: 19. Remove Nth Node From End of List
item.description: LeetCode problem Given the ‘head’ of a linked list, remove the ’nth’ node from the end of the list and return its head. Example 1: Input: head = [1,2,3,4,5], n = 2 Output: [1,2,3,5] Example 2: Input: head = [1], n = 1 Output: [] First accepted Create Linked List Idea: Two pointers. Second pointer starts from nth position. Run while second pointer exist. First version: # Definition for singly-linked list. # class ListNode: # def __init__(self, val=0, next=None): # self.
